style.atDirectives.@-moz-document.descri: Gecko-specific at-rule that restricts the style rules contained within it based on the URL of the document.
style.atDirectives.@-moz-keyframes.descr: Defines set of animation key frames.
style.atDirectives.@-ms-viewport.descrip: Specifies the size, zoom factor, and orientation of the viewport.
style.atDirectives.@-o-keyframes.descrip: Defines set of animation key frames.
style.atDirectives.@-o-viewport.descript: Specifies the size, zoom factor, and orientation of the viewport.
style.atDirectives.@-webkit-keyframes.de: Defines set of animation key frames.
style.atDirectives.@charset.description: The @charset CSS at-rule specifies the character encoding used in the style sheet. It must be the first element in the style sheet and not be preceded by any character; as it is not a nested statement, it cannot be used inside conditional group at-rules. If several @charset at-rules are defined, only the first one is used, and it cannot be used inside a style attribute on an HTML element or inside the <style> element where the character set of the HTML page is relevant.
style.atDirectives.@counter-style.descri: The @counter-style CSS at-rule lets you define counter styles that are not part of the predefined set of styles. A @counter-style rule defines how to convert a counter value into a string representation.
style.atDirectives.@font-face.descriptio: The @font-face CSS at-rule specifies a custom font with which to display text; the font can be loaded from either a remote server or a locally-installed font on the user's own computer.
style.atDirectives.@font-face.values.fon: 所指定的字体名字将会被用于 font 或 font-family 属性 ( i.e. font-family: <family-name>; )
对于 src 所指字体的描述。如果所需字体符合描述，则采用本 font-face 所定义的字体。
style.atDirectives.@font-face.values.src: 远程字体文件位置的 URL 或者用户计算机上的字体名称，可以使用 local 语法通过名称指定用户的本地计算机上的字体 ( i.e. src: local('Arial'); )。如果找不到该字体，将会尝试其他来源，直到找到它。
style.atDirectives.@font-face.values.uni: 在该 @font-face 中定义的 unicode 字体范围
The @font-feature-values CSS at-rule lets you use a common name in the font-variant-alternates property for features activated differently in OpenType. This can help simplify your CSS when using multiple fonts.
style.atDirectives.@import.description:
The @import CSS at-rule is used to import style rules from other valid stylesheets.
  An @import rule must be defined at the top of the stylesheet, before any other at-rule (except @charset and @layer) and style declarations, or it will be ignored.
style.atDirectives.@keyframes.descriptio: The @keyframes CSS at-rule controls the intermediate steps in a CSS animation sequence by defining styles for keyframes (or waypoints) along the animation sequence. This gives more control over the intermediate steps of the animation sequence than transitions.
style.atDirectives.@layer.description: The @layer CSS at-rule is used to declare a cascade layer and can also be used to define the order of precedence in case of multiple cascade layers.
style.atDirectives.@media.description: The @media CSS at-rule can be used to apply part of a style sheet based on the result of one or more media queries. With it, you specify a media query and a block of CSS to apply to the document if and only if the media query matches the device on which the content is being used.
style.atDirectives.@namespace.descriptio: @namespace is an at-rule that defines XML namespaces to be used in a CSS style sheet.
style.atDirectives.@page.description: The @page at-rule is a CSS at-rule used to modify different aspects of printed pages. It targets and modifies the page's dimensions, orientation, and margins. The @page at-rule can be used to target all pages in a print-out or a subset using its various pseudo-classes.
style.atDirectives.@property.description: The @property CSS at-rule is part of the CSS Houdini umbrella of APIs. It allows developers to explicitly define their CSS custom properties, allowing for property type checking and constraining, setting default values, and defining whether a custom property can inherit values or not.
style.atDirectives.@supports.description:
The @supports CSS at-rule lets you specify CSS declarations that depend on a browser's support for CSS features.
  Using this at-rule is commonly called a feature query.
  The rule must be placed at the top level of your code or nested inside any other conditional group at-rule.
style.properties.-moz-animation-delay.de: Defines when the animation will start.
style.properties.-moz-animation-directio: Defines whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.
The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.
The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.
All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.
style.properties.-moz-animation-duration: Defines the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.
style.properties.-moz-animation-iteratio: Defines the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once.
Causes the animation to repeat forever.
style.properties.-moz-animation-name.des: Defines a list of animations that apply. Each name is used to select the keyframe at-rule that provides the property values for the animation.
style.properties.-moz-animation-play-sta: Defines whether the animation is running or paused.
A running animation will be paused.
Resume playback of a paused animation.
style.properties.-moz-animation-timing-f: Describes how the animation will progress over one cycle of its duration. See the 'transition-timing-function'.
style.properties.-moz-animation.descript: Shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.
style.properties.-moz-animation.values.a: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.
The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.
style.properties.-moz-animation.values.b: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.
Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.
style.properties.-moz-animation.values.f: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.
style.properties.-moz-animation.values.i: Causes the animation to repeat forever.
style.properties.-moz-animation.values.r: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.
style.properties.-moz-appearance.descrip: Used in Gecko (Firefox) to display an element using a platform-native styling based on the operating system's theme.
style.properties.-moz-backface-visibilit: Determines whether or not the 'back' side of a transformed element is visible when facing the viewer. With an identity transform, the front side of an element faces the viewer.
style.properties.-moz-background-inline-: In Gecko-based applications like Firefox, the -moz-background-inline-policy CSS property specifies how the background image of an inline element is determined when the content of the inline element wraps onto multiple lines. The choice of position has significant effects on repetition.
For elements rendered as a single box, specifies the background positioning area. For elements rendered as multiple boxes (e.g., inline boxes on several lines, boxes on several pages) specifies which boxes 'box-decoration-break' operates on to determine the background positioning area(s).
style.properties.-moz-binding.descriptio: The -moz-binding CSS property is used by Mozilla-based applications to attach an XBL binding to a DOM element.
style.properties.-moz-border-bottom-colo: Sets a list of colors for the bottom border.
style.properties.-moz-border-image.descr: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.
style.properties.-moz-border-image.value: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.
Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.
The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.
The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.
The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.
The image is stretched to fill the area.
style.properties.-moz-border-left-colors: Sets a list of colors for the bottom border.
style.properties.-moz-border-right-color: Sets a list of colors for the bottom border.
Ske Firefox, -moz-border-bottom-colors sets a list of colors for the bottom border.
style.properties.-moz-box-align.descript: Specifies how a XUL box aligns its contents across (perpendicular to) the direction of its layout. The effect of this is only visible if there is extra space in the box.
style.properties.-moz-box-align.values.b: If this box orientation is inline-axis or horizontal, all children are placed with their baselines aligned, and extra space placed before or after as necessary. For block flows, the baseline of the first non-empty line box located within the element is used. For tables, the baseline of the first cell is used.
style.properties.-moz-box-align.values.c: Any extra space is divided evenly, with half placed above the child and the other half placed after the child.
style.properties.-moz-box-align.values.e: For normal direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element. For reverse direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element.
style.properties.-moz-box-align.values.s: For normal direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element. For reverse direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element.
The height of each child is adjusted to that of the containing block.
style.properties.-moz-box-direction.desc: Specifies whether a box lays out its contents normally (from the top or left edge), or in reverse (from the bottom or right edge).
style.properties.-moz-box-direction.valu: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from left to right. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from top to bottom.
A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from right to left. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from bottom to top.
style.properties.-moz-box-flex.descripti: Specifies how a box grows to fill the box that contains it, in the direction of the containing box's layout.
style.properties.-moz-box-flexgroup.desc: Flexible elements can be assigned to flex groups using the 'box-flex-group' property.
Indicates the ordinal group the element belongs to. Elements with a lower ordinal group are displayed before those with a higher ordinal group.
style.properties.-moz-box-orient.descrip: In Mozilla applications, -moz-box-orient specifies whether a box lays out its contents horizontally or vertically.
Elements are oriented along the box's axis.
The box displays its children from left to right in a horizontal line.
The box displays its children from stacked from top to bottom vertically.
style.properties.-moz-box-pack.descripti: Specifies how a box packs its contents in the direction of its layout. The effect of this is only visible if there is extra space in the box.
style.properties.-moz-box-pack.values.ce: The extra space is divided evenly, with half placed before the first child and the other half placed after the last child.
style.properties.-moz-box-pack.values.en: For normal direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child. For reverse direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child.
style.properties.-moz-box-pack.values.ju: The space is divided evenly in-between each child, with none of the extra space placed before the first child or after the last child. If there is only one child, treat the pack value as if it were start.
style.properties.-moz-box-pack.values.st: For normal direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child. For reverse direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child.
The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) on this element determine the border box of the element.
Behavior of width and height as specified by CSS2.1. The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) apply to the width and height respectively of the content box of the element.
The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) on this element determine the padding box of the element.
style.properties.-moz-column-count.descr: Describes the optimal number of columns into which the content of the element will be flowed.
style.properties.-moz-column-count.value: Determines the number of columns by the 'column-width' property and the element width.
style.properties.-moz-column-gap.descrip: Sets the gap between columns. If there is a column rule between columns, it will appear in the middle of the gap.
User agent specific and typically equivalent to 1em.
Sets the color of the column rule
Sets the style of the rule between columns of an element.
Sets the width of the rule between columns. Negative values are not allowed.
style.properties.-moz-column-rule.descri: Shorthand for setting 'column-rule-width', 'column-rule-style', and 'column-rule-color' at the same place in the style sheet. Omitted values are set to their initial values.
style.properties.-moz-column-width.descr: This property describes the width of columns in multicol elements.
style.properties.-moz-column-width.value: The width depends on the values of other properties.
style.properties.-moz-columns.descriptio: A shorthand property which sets both 'column-width' and 'column-count'.
style.properties.-moz-columns.values.aut: The width depends on the values of other properties.
style.properties.-moz-context-properties: If you reference an SVG image in a webpage (such as with the element or as a background image), the SVG image can coordinate with the embedding element (its context) to have the image adopt property values set on the embedding element. To do this the embedding element needs to list the properties that are to be made available to the image by listing them as values of the -moz-context-properties property, and the image needs to opt in to using those properties by using values such as the context-fill value. This feature is available since Firefox 55, but is only currently supported with SVG images loaded via chrome:// or resource:// URLs. To experiment with the feature in SVG on the Web it is necessary to set the svg.context-properties.content.enabled pref to true.
style.properties.-moz-float-edge.descrip: The non-standard -moz-float-edge CSS property specifies whether the height and width properties of the element include the margin, border, or padding thickness.
The height and width properties include the content, padding and border but not the margin.
The height and width properties include the content, but not the padding, border or margin.
The height and width properties include the content, padding, border and margin.
The height and width properties include the content and padding but not the border or margin.
style.properties.-moz-font-feature-setti: Provides low-level control over OpenType font features. It is intended as a way of providing access to font features that are not widely used but are needed for a particular use case.
No change in glyph substitution or positioning occurs.
style.properties.-moz-force-broken-image: The -moz-force-broken-image-icon extended CSS property can be used to force the broken image icon to be shown even when a broken image has an alt attribute.
style.properties.-moz-hyphens.descriptio: Controls whether hyphenation is allowed to create more break opportunities within a line of text.
style.properties.-moz-hyphens.values.aut: Conditional hyphenation characters inside a word, if present, take priority over automatic resources when determining hyphenation points within the word.
style.properties.-moz-hyphens.values.man: Words are only broken at line breaks where there are characters inside the word that suggest line break opportunities
style.properties.-moz-hyphens.values.non: Words are not broken at line breaks, even if characters inside the word suggest line break points.
style.properties.-moz-image-region.descr: For certain XUL elements and pseudo-elements that use an image from the list-style-image property, this property specifies a region of the image that is used in place of the whole image. This allows elements to use different pieces of the same image to improve performance.
style.properties.-moz-image-region.value: Automatically defines the region of the image to use.
style.properties.-moz-orient.description: The -moz-orient CSS property specifies the orientation of the element to which it's applied.
style.properties.-moz-orient.values.bloc: The element is rendered orthogonally to the axis of the text: vertically for horizontal writing modes, horizontal for vertical writing modes.
style.properties.-moz-orient.values.inli: The element is rendered in the same direction as the axis of the text: horizontally for horizontal writing modes, vertically for vertical writing modes.
style.properties.-moz-outline-radius-bot: In Mozilla applications, the -moz-outline-radius-bottomleft CSS property can be used to round the bottom-left corner of an element's outline.
In Mozilla applications, the -moz-outline-radius-bottomright CSS property can be used to round the bottom-right corner of an element's outline.
style.properties.-moz-outline-radius-top: In Mozilla applications, the -moz-outline-radius-topleft CSS property can be used to round the top-left corner of an element's outline.
In Mozilla applications, the -moz-outline-radius-topright CSS property can be used to round the top-right corner of an element's outline.
style.properties.-moz-outline-radius.des: In Mozilla applications like Firefox, the -moz-outline-radius CSS property can be used to give an element's outline rounded corners.
style.properties.-moz-perspective-origin: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X and Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.
style.properties.-moz-perspective.descri: Applies the same transform as the perspective(<number>) transform function, except that it applies only to the positioned or transformed children of the element, not to the transform on the element itself.
style.properties.-moz-stack-sizing.descr: -moz-stack-sizing is an extended CSS property. Normally, a stack will change its size so that all of its child elements are completely visible. For example, moving a child of the stack far to the right will widen the stack so the child remains visible.
style.properties.-moz-text-align-last.de: Describes how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break is aligned when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'.
style.properties.-moz-text-align-last.va: The inline contents are centered within the line box.
The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.
The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.
The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.
style.properties.-moz-text-blink.descrip: The -moz-text-blink non-standard Mozilla CSS extension specifies the blink mode.
style.properties.-moz-text-decoration-co: Specifies the color of text decoration (underlines overlines, and line-throughs) set on the element with text-decoration-line.
style.properties.-moz-text-decoration-li: Specifies what line decorations, if any, are added to the element.
Each line of text has a line through the middle.
Neither produces nor inhibits text decoration.
Each line of text has a line above it.
Each line of text is underlined.
style.properties.-moz-text-decoration-st: Specifies the line style for underline, line-through and overline text decoration.
style.properties.-moz-text-size-adjust.d: Specifies a size adjustment for displaying text content in mobile browsers.
style.properties.-moz-text-size-adjust.v: Renderers must use the default size adjustment when displaying on a small device.
Renderers must not do size adjustment when displaying on a small device.
style.properties.-moz-transform-origin.d: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.
style.properties.-moz-transform.descript: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.
style.properties.-moz-transform.values.m: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]
Specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.
style.properties.-moz-transform.values.r: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.
Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.
Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.
Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.
Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.
style.properties.-moz-transform.values.s: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.
Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.
Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.
Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.
Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.

Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).
Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.
Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.
style.properties.-moz-transform.values.t: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.
Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.
Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.
Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.
Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.
style.properties.-moz-transition-delay.d: Defines when the transition will start. It allows a transition to begin execution some period of time from when it is applied.
style.properties.-moz-transition-duratio: Specifies how long the transition from the old value to the new value should take.
style.properties.-moz-transition-propert: Specifies the name of the CSS property to which the transition is applied.
Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.
style.properties.-moz-transition-timing-: Describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated.
style.properties.-moz-transition.descrip: Shorthand property combines four of the transition properties into a single property.
Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.
style.properties.-moz-user-focus.descrip: The -moz-user-focus CSS property is used to indicate whether an element can have the focus.
The element does not accept the keyboard focus and will be skipped in the tab order.
The element can accept the keyboard focus.
style.properties.-moz-user-input.descrip: In Mozilla applications, -moz-user-input determines if an element will accept user input.
The element does not accept user input. However, this is not the same as setting disabled to true, in that the element is drawn normally. Please note that this value is no longer supported in Firefox 60 onwards (Firefox bug 1405087).
The element accepts user input. For textboxes, this is the default behavior. Please note that this value is no longer supported in Firefox 60 onwards (Firefox bug 1405087).
The element does not respond to user input, and it does not become :active.
style.properties.-moz-user-modify.descri: The -moz-user-modify property has no effect. It was originally planned to determine whether or not the content of an element can be edited by a user.
style.properties.-moz-window-dragging.de: The -moz-window-dragging CSS property specifies whether a window is draggable or not. It only works in Chrome code, and only on Mac OS X.
style.properties.-moz-window-shadow.desc: The -moz-window-shadow CSS property specifies whether a window will have a shadow. It only works on Mac OS X.
style.properties.-ms-accelerator.descrip: IE only. Has the ability to turn off its system underlines for accelerator keys until the ALT key is pressed
The element does not contain an accelerator key sequence.
The element contains an accelerator key sequence.
style.properties.-ms-behavior.descriptio: IE only. Used to extend behaviors of the browser
style.properties.-ms-block-progression.d: Sets the block-progression value and the flow orientation
style.properties.-ms-block-progression.v: Bottom-to-top block flow. Layout is horizontal.
Left-to-right direction. The flow orientation is vertical.
Right-to-left direction. The flow orientation is vertical.
Top-to-bottom direction. The flow orientation is horizontal.
style.properties.-ms-content-zoom-chaini: Specifies the zoom behavior that occurs when a user hits the zoom limit during a manipulation.
The nearest zoomable parent element begins zooming when the user hits a zoom limit during a manipulation. No bounce effect is shown.
A bounce effect is shown when the user hits a zoom limit during a manipulation.
Shorthand property for the -ms-content-zoom-limit-min and -ms-content-zoom-limit-max properties.
style.properties.-ms-content-zoom-snap-p: Defines where zoom snap-points are located.
Specifies where the snap-points will be placed.
Specifies the position of individual snap-points as a comma-separated list of zoom factors.
style.properties.-ms-content-zoom-snap-t: Specifies how zooming is affected by defined snap-points.
Indicates that the motion of the content after the contact is picked up is always adjusted so that it lands on a snap-point.
Indicates that zooming is unaffected by any defined snap-points.
Indicates that the motion of the content after the contact is picked up may be adjusted if the content would normally stop "close enough" to a snap-point.
style.properties.-ms-content-zoom-snap.d: Shorthand property for the -ms-content-zoom-snap-type and -ms-content-zoom-snap-points properties.
style.properties.-ms-content-zoom-snap.v: Indicates that the motion of the content after the contact is picked up is always adjusted so that it lands on a snap-point.
Indicates that zooming is unaffected by any defined snap-points.
Indicates that the motion of the content after the contact is picked up may be adjusted if the content would normally stop "close enough" to a snap-point.
Specifies where the snap-points will be placed.
Specifies the position of individual snap-points as a comma-separated list of zoom factors.
style.properties.-ms-filter.description: IE only. Used to produce visual effects.
style.properties.-ms-flex-align.descript: Aligns flex items along the cross axis of the current line of the flex container.
style.properties.-ms-flex-align.values.b: If the flex item's inline axis is the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to 'flex-start'. Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment.
style.properties.-ms-flex-align.values.c: The flex item's margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line.
style.properties.-ms-flex-align.values.e: The cross-end margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.
style.properties.-ms-flex-align.values.s: The cross-start margin edge of the flexbox item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.
If the cross size property of the flexbox item is anything other than 'auto', this value is identical to 'start'.
style.properties.-ms-flex-direction.desc: Specifies how flex items are placed in the flex container, by setting the direction of the flex container's main axis.
style.properties.-ms-flex-direction.valu: Same as 'column', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.
The flex container's main axis has the same orientation as the block axis of the current writing mode.
Same as 'row', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.
The flex container's main axis has the same orientation as the inline axis of the current writing mode.
style.properties.-ms-flex-flow.descripti: Specifies how flexbox items are placed in the flexbox.
style.properties.-ms-flex-flow.values.co: Same as 'column', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.
The flex container's main axis has the same orientation as the block axis of the current writing mode.
style.properties.-ms-flex-flow.values.ro: The flex container's main axis has the same orientation as the inline axis of the current writing mode.
style.properties.-ms-flex-flow.values.wr: Same as 'wrap', except the cross-start and cross-end directions are swapped.
style.properties.-ms-flex-item-align.des: Allows the default alignment along the cross axis to be overridden for individual flex items.
style.properties.-ms-flex-item-align.val: Computes to the value of 'align-items' on the element's parent, or 'stretch' if the element has no parent. On absolutely positioned elements, it computes to itself.
If the flex item's inline axis is the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to 'flex-start'. Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment.
The flex item's margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line.
The cross-end margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.
The cross-start margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.
If the cross size property of the flex item computes to auto, and neither of the cross-axis margins are auto, the flex item is stretched.
style.properties.-ms-flex-line-pack.desc: Aligns a flex container's lines within the flex container when there is extra space in the cross-axis, similar to how 'justify-content' aligns individual items within the main-axis.
style.properties.-ms-flex-line-pack.valu: Lines are packed toward the center of the flex container.
Lines are evenly distributed in the flex container, with half-size spaces on either end.
Lines are packed toward the end of the flex container.
Lines are evenly distributed in the flex container.
Lines are packed toward the start of the flex container.
Lines stretch to take up the remaining space.
style.properties.-ms-flex-order.descript: Controls the order in which children of a flex container appear within the flex container, by assigning them to ordinal groups.
style.properties.-ms-flex-pack.descripti: Aligns flex items along the main axis of the current line of the flex container.
style.properties.-ms-flex-pack.values.ce: Flex items are packed toward the center of the line.
style.properties.-ms-flex-pack.values.di: Flex items are evenly distributed in the line, with half-size spaces on either end.
style.properties.-ms-flex-pack.values.en: Flex items are packed toward the end of the line.
style.properties.-ms-flex-pack.values.ju: Flex items are evenly distributed in the line.
style.properties.-ms-flex-pack.values.st: Flex items are packed toward the start of the line.
style.properties.-ms-flex-wrap.descripti: Controls whether the flex container is single-line or multi-line, and the direction of the cross-axis, which determines the direction new lines are stacked in.
style.properties.-ms-flex-wrap.values.wr: Same as 'wrap', except the cross-start and cross-end directions are swapped.
style.properties.-ms-flex.description: specifies the parameters of a flexible length: the positive and negative flexibility, and the preferred size.
style.properties.-ms-flex.values.auto.de: Retrieves the value of the main size property as the used 'flex-basis'.
style.properties.-ms-flow-from.descripti: Makes a block container a region and associates it with a named flow.
style.properties.-ms-flow-from.values.no: The block container is not a CSS Region.
style.properties.-ms-flow-into.descripti: Places an element or its contents into a named flow.
style.properties.-ms-flow-into.values.no: The element is not moved to a named flow and normal CSS processing takes place.
style.properties.-ms-grid-column-align.d: Aligns the columns in a grid.
style.properties.-ms-grid-column-align.v: Places the center of the Grid Item's margin box at the center of the Grid Item's column.
Aligns the end edge of the Grid Item's margin box to the end edge of the Grid Item's column.
Aligns the starting edge of the Grid Item's margin box to the starting edge of the Grid Item's column.
Ensures that the Grid Item's margin box is equal to the size of the Grid Item's column.
style.properties.-ms-grid-column-span.de: Specifies the number of columns to span.
style.properties.-ms-grid-column.descrip: Used to place grid items and explicitly defined grid cells in the Grid.
style.properties.-ms-grid-columns.descri: Lays out the columns of the grid.
style.properties.-ms-grid-layer.descript: Grid-layer is similar in concept to z-index, but avoids overloading the meaning of the z-index property, which is applicable only to positioned elements.
style.properties.-ms-grid-row-align.desc: Aligns the rows in a grid.
style.properties.-ms-grid-row-align.valu: Places the center of the Grid Item's margin box at the center of the Grid Item's row.
Aligns the end edge of the Grid Item's margin box to the end edge of the Grid Item's row.
Aligns the starting edge of the Grid Item's margin box to the starting edge of the Grid Item's row.
Ensures that the Grid Item's margin box is equal to the size of the Grid Item's row.
style.properties.-ms-grid-row-span.descr: Specifies the number of rows to span.
style.properties.-ms-grid-row.descriptio: grid-row is used to place grid items and explicitly defined grid cells in the Grid.
style.properties.-ms-grid-rows.descripti: Lays out the columns of the grid.
style.properties.-ms-high-contrast-adjus: Specifies if properties should be adjusted in high contrast mode.
Properties will be adjusted as applicable.
style.properties.-ms-hyphenate-limit-cha: Specifies the minimum number of characters in a hyphenated word.
The user agent chooses a value that adapts to the current layout.
style.properties.-ms-hyphenate-limit-lin: Indicates the maximum number of successive hyphenated lines in an element.
style.properties.-ms-hyphenate-limit-zon: Specifies the maximum amount of unfilled space (before justification) that may be left in the line box before hyphenation is triggered to pull part of a word from the next line back up into the current line.
style.properties.-ms-hyphens.description: Controls whether hyphenation is allowed to create more break opportunities within a line of text.
style.properties.-ms-hyphens.values.auto: Conditional hyphenation characters inside a word, if present, take priority over automatic resources when determining hyphenation points within the word.
style.properties.-ms-hyphens.values.manu: Words are only broken at line breaks where there are characters inside the word that suggest line break opportunities
style.properties.-ms-hyphens.values.none: Words are not broken at line breaks, even if characters inside the word suggest line break points.
style.properties.-ms-ime-align.descripti: Aligns the Input Method Editor (IME) candidate window box relative to the element on which the IME composition is active.
style.properties.-ms-ime-mode.descriptio: Controls the state of the input method editor for text fields.
style.properties.-ms-ime-mode.values.act: The input method editor is initially active; text entry is performed using it unless the user specifically dismisses it.
style.properties.-ms-ime-mode.values.aut: No change is made to the current input method editor state. This is the default.
style.properties.-ms-ime-mode.values.dis: The input method editor is disabled and may not be activated by the user.
style.properties.-ms-ime-mode.values.ina: The input method editor is initially inactive, but the user may activate it if they wish.
style.properties.-ms-ime-mode.values.nor: The IME state should be normal; this value can be used in a user style sheet to override the page setting.
Gets or sets the interpolation (resampling) method used to stretch images.
style.properties.-ms-layout-grid-char.de: Sets or retrieves the size of the character grid used for rendering the text content of an element.
style.properties.-ms-layout-grid-char.va: Largest character in the font of the element is used to set the character grid.
Default. No character grid is set.
style.properties.-ms-layout-grid-line.de: Sets or retrieves the gridline value used for rendering the text content of an element.
style.properties.-ms-layout-grid-line.va: Largest character in the font of the element is used to set the character grid.
Default. No grid line is set.
style.properties.-ms-layout-grid-mode.de: Gets or sets whether the text layout grid uses two dimensions.
style.properties.-ms-layout-grid-mode.va: Default. Both the char and line grid modes are enabled. This setting is necessary to fully enable the layout grid on an element.
Only a character grid is used. This is recommended for use with block-level elements, such as a blockquote, where the line grid is intended to be disabled.
Only a line grid is used. This is recommended for use with inline elements, such as a span, to disable the horizontal grid on runs of text that act as a single entity in the grid layout.
style.properties.-ms-layout-grid-type.de: Sets or retrieves the type of grid used for rendering the text content of an element.
style.properties.-ms-layout-grid-type.va: Grid used for monospaced layout. All noncursive characters are treated as equal; every character is centered within a single grid space by default.
Default. Grid used for Japanese and Korean characters.
Grid used for Chinese, as well as Japanese (Genko) and Korean characters. Only the ideographs, kanas, and wide characters are snapped to the grid.
style.properties.-ms-layout-grid.descrip: Sets or retrieves the composite document grid properties that specify the layout of text characters.
Any of the range of character values available to the -ms-layout-grid-char property.
Any of the range of line values available to the -ms-layout-grid-line property.
Any of the range of mode values available to the -ms-layout-grid-mode property.
Any of the range of type values available to the -ms-layout-grid-type property.
style.properties.-ms-line-break.descript: Specifies what set of line breaking restrictions are in effect within the element.
style.properties.-ms-line-break.values.a: The UA determines the set of line-breaking restrictions to use for CJK scripts, and it may vary the restrictions based on the length of the line; e.g., use a less restrictive set of line-break rules for short lines.
style.properties.-ms-line-break.values.k: Sequences of CJK characters can no longer break on implied break points. This option should only be used where the presence of word separator characters still creates line-breaking opportunities, as in Korean.
style.properties.-ms-line-break.values.n: Breaks CJK scripts using the least restrictive set of line-breaking rules. Typically used for short lines, such as in newspapers.
Breaks CJK scripts using a normal set of line-breaking rules.
style.properties.-ms-line-break.values.s: Breaks CJK scripts using a more restrictive set of line-breaking rules than 'normal'.
style.properties.-ms-overflow-style.desc: Specify whether content is clipped when it overflows the element's content area.
style.properties.-ms-overflow-style.valu: Indicates the element displays auto-hiding scrollbars during mouse interactions and panning indicators during touch and keyboard interactions.
No preference, UA should use the first scrolling method in the list that it supports.
Indicates the element does not display scrollbars or panning indicators, even when its content overflows.

Scrollbars are typically narrow strips inserted on one or two edges of an element and which often have arrows to click on and a "thumb" to drag up and down (or left and right) to move the contents of the element.
style.properties.-ms-perspective-origin-: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X  position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.
Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.
Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X and Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.
style.properties.-ms-perspective.descrip: Applies the same transform as the perspective(<number>) transform function, except that it applies only to the positioned or transformed children of the element, not to the transform on the element itself.
style.properties.-ms-progress-appearance: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a progress control displays as a bar or a ring.
style.properties.-ms-scroll-chaining.des: Gets or sets a value that indicates the scrolling behavior that occurs when a user hits the content boundary during a manipulation.
Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum value for the scrollLeft property.
Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum value for the scrollLeft property.
Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum value for the scrollTop property.
Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum value for the scrollTop property.
style.properties.-ms-scroll-limit.descri: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-scroll-limit-x-min, -ms-scroll-limit-y-min, -ms-scroll-limit-x-max, and -ms-scroll-limit-y-max properties.
style.properties.-ms-scroll-rails.descri: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether or not small motions perpendicular to the primary axis of motion will result in either changes to both the scrollTop and scrollLeft properties or a change to the primary axis (for instance, either the scrollTop or scrollLeft properties will change, but not both).
style.properties.-ms-scroll-snap-points-: Gets or sets a value that defines where snap-points will be located along the x-axis.
Gets or sets a value that defines where snap-points will be located along the y-axis.
style.properties.-ms-scroll-snap-type.de: Gets or sets a value that defines what type of snap-point should be used for the current element. There are two type of snap-points, with the primary difference being whether or not the user is guaranteed to always stop on a snap-point.
style.properties.-ms-scroll-snap-type.va: The visual viewport of this scroll container is guaranteed to rest on a snap point when there are no active scrolling operations.
The visual viewport of this scroll container must ignore snap points, if any, when scrolled.
The visual viewport of this scroll container may come to rest on a snap point at the termination of a scroll at the discretion of the UA given the parameters of the scroll.
style.properties.-ms-scroll-snap-x.descr: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-scroll-snap-type and -ms-scroll-snap-points-x properties.
style.properties.-ms-scroll-snap-y.descr: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-scroll-snap-type and -ms-scroll-snap-points-y properties.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether vertical-to-horizontal scroll wheel translation occurs on the specified element.
style.properties.-ms-scrollbar-3dlight-c: Determines the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.
style.properties.-ms-scrollbar-arrow-col: Determines the color of the arrow elements of a scroll arrow.
style.properties.-ms-scrollbar-base-colo: Determines the color of the main elements of a scroll bar, which include the scroll box, track, and scroll arrows.
style.properties.-ms-scrollbar-darkshado: Determines the color of the gutter of a scroll bar.
style.properties.-ms-scrollbar-face-colo: Determines the color of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.
style.properties.-ms-scrollbar-highlight: Determines the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.
style.properties.-ms-scrollbar-shadow-co: Determines the color of the bottom and right edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.
style.properties.-ms-scrollbar-track-col: Determines the color of the track element of a scroll bar.
style.properties.-ms-text-align-last.des: Describes how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break is aligned when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'.
style.properties.-ms-text-align-last.val: The inline contents are centered within the line box.
The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.
The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.
The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.
style.properties.-ms-text-autospace.desc: Determines whether or not a full-width punctuation mark character should be trimmed if it appears at the beginning of a line, so that its 'ink' lines up with the first glyph in the line above and below.
style.properties.-ms-text-autospace.valu: Creates 1/4em extra spacing between runs of ideographic letters and non-ideographic letters, such as Latin-based, Cyrillic, Greek, Arabic or Hebrew.
Creates 1/4em extra spacing between runs of ideographic letters and numeric glyphs.
Creates extra spacing between normal (non wide) parenthesis and ideographs.
Extends the width of the space character while surrounded by ideographs.
Creates extra non-breaking spacing around punctuation as required by language-specific typographic conventions.
style.properties.-ms-text-combine-horizo: This property specifies the combination of multiple characters into the space of a single character.
Attempt to typeset horizontally all consecutive characters within the box such that they take up the space of a single character within the vertical line box.

Attempt to typeset horizontally each maximal sequence of consecutive ASCII digits (U+0030-U+0039) that has as many or fewer characters than the specified integer such that it takes up the space of a single character within the vertical line box.
style.properties.-ms-text-justify.descri: Selects the justification algorithm used when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'. The property applies to block containers, but the UA may (but is not required to) also support it on inline elements.
style.properties.-ms-text-justify.values: The UA determines the justification algorithm to follow, based on a balance between performance and adequate presentation quality.

Justification primarily changes spacing both at word separators and at grapheme cluster boundaries in all scripts except those in the connected and cursive groups. This value is sometimes used in e.g. Japanese, often with the 'text-align-last' property.
Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators and at grapheme cluster boundaries in clustered scripts. This value is typically used for Southeast Asian scripts such as Thai.
Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators and at inter-graphemic boundaries in scripts that use no word spaces. This value is typically used for CJK languages.
Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators. This value is typically used for languages that separate words using spaces, like English or (sometimes) Korean.
Justification primarily stretches Arabic and related scripts through the use of kashida or other calligraphic elongation.
Sets or retrieves the ratio of kashida expansion to white space expansion when justifying lines of text in the object.
style.properties.-ms-text-overflow.descr: Text can overflow for example when it is prevented from wrapping
style.properties.-ms-text-overflow.value: Clip inline content that overflows. Characters may be only partially rendered.
Render an ellipsis character (U+2026) to represent clipped inline content.
style.properties.-ms-text-size-adjust.de: Specifies a size adjustment for displaying text content in mobile browsers.
style.properties.-ms-text-size-adjust.va: Renderers must use the default size adjustment when displaying on a small device.
Renderers must not do size adjustment when displaying on a small device.
style.properties.-ms-text-underline-posi: Sets the position of an underline specified on the same element: it does not affect underlines specified by ancestor elements.This property is typically used in vertical writing contexts such as in Japanese documents where it often desired to have the underline appear 'over' (to the right of) the affected run of text
The underline is aligned with the alphabetic baseline. In this case the underline is likely to cross some descenders.

The user agent may use any algorithm to determine the underline's position. In horizontal line layout, the underline should be aligned as for alphabetic. In vertical line layout, if the language is set to Japanese or Korean, the underline should be aligned as for over.
The underline is aligned with the 'top' (right in vertical writing) edge of the element's em-box. In this mode, an overline also switches sides.

The underline is aligned with the 'bottom' (left in vertical writing) edge of the element's em-box. In this case the underline usually does not cross the descenders. This is sometimes called 'accounting' underline.
style.properties.-ms-touch-action.descri: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether and how a given region can be manipulated by the user.
style.properties.-ms-touch-action.values: The element is a passive element, with several exceptions.
The element will zoom on double-tap.
The element is a manipulation-causing element.
The element is a manipulation-blocking element.
The element permits touch-driven panning on the horizontal axis. The touch pan is performed on the nearest ancestor with horizontally scrollable content.
The element permits touch-driven panning on the vertical axis. The touch pan is performed on the nearest ancestor with vertically scrollable content.
The element permits pinch-zooming. The pinch-zoom is performed on the nearest ancestor with zoomable content.
style.properties.-ms-touch-select.descri: Gets or sets a value that toggles the 'gripper' visual elements that enable touch text selection.
The x coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.
The y coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.
The z coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.
style.properties.-ms-transform-origin.de: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.
style.properties.-ms-transform.descripti: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.
style.properties.-ms-transform.values.ma: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]
Specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.
style.properties.-ms-transform.values.ro: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.
Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.
Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.
Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.
Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.
style.properties.-ms-transform.values.sc: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.
Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.
Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.
Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.
Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.
style.properties.-ms-transform.values.sk: Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).
Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.
Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.
style.properties.-ms-transform.values.tr: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.
Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.
Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.
Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.
Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.
style.properties.-ms-word-break.descript: Specifies line break opportunities for non-CJK scripts.
style.properties.-ms-word-break.values.b: Lines may break between any two grapheme clusters for non-CJK scripts.
style.properties.-ms-word-break.values.k: Block characters can no longer create implied break points.
style.properties.-ms-word-break.values.n: Breaks non-CJK scripts according to their own rules.
style.properties.-ms-word-wrap.descripti: Specifies whether the UA may break within a word to prevent overflow when an otherwise-unbreakable string is too long to fit.
style.properties.-ms-word-wrap.values.br: An unbreakable 'word' may be broken at an arbitrary point if there are no otherwise-acceptable break points in the line.
style.properties.-ms-word-wrap.values.no: Lines may break only at allowed break points.
style.properties.-ms-wrap-flow.descripti: An element becomes an exclusion when its 'wrap-flow' property has a computed value other than 'auto'.
style.properties.-ms-wrap-flow.values.au: For floats an exclusion is created, for all other elements an exclusion is not created.
style.properties.-ms-wrap-flow.values.bo: Inline flow content can flow on all sides of the exclusion.
style.properties.-ms-wrap-flow.values.cl: Inline flow content can only wrap on top and bottom of the exclusion and must leave the areas to the start and end edges of the exclusion box empty.
style.properties.-ms-wrap-flow.values.en: Inline flow content can wrap on the end side of the exclusion area but must leave the area to the start edge of the exclusion area empty.
style.properties.-ms-wrap-flow.values.ma: Inline flow content can wrap on the side of the exclusion with the largest available space for the given line, and must leave the other side of the exclusion empty.
style.properties.-ms-wrap-flow.values.mi: Inline flow content can flow around the edge of the exclusion with the smallest available space within the flow content's containing block, and must leave the other edge of the exclusion empty.
style.properties.-ms-wrap-flow.values.st: Inline flow content can wrap on the start edge of the exclusion area but must leave the area to end edge of the exclusion area empty.
style.properties.-ms-wrap-margin.descrip: Gets or sets a value that is used to offset the inner wrap shape from other shapes.
style.properties.-ms-wrap-through.descri: Specifies if an element inherits its parent wrapping context. In other words if it is subject to the exclusions defined outside the element.
style.properties.-ms-wrap-through.values: The exclusion element does not inherit its parent node's wrapping context. Its descendants are only subject to exclusion shapes defined inside the element.
The exclusion element inherits its parent node's wrapping context. Its descendant inline content wraps around exclusions defined outside the element.
style.properties.-ms-zoom-animation.desc: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether an animation is used when zooming.
style.properties.-ms-zoom.description: Sets or retrieves the magnification scale of the object.
style.properties.-o-animation-delay.desc: Defines when the animation will start.
Defines whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.
The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.
The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.
All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.
style.properties.-o-animation-duration.d: Defines the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.
Defines what values are applied by the animation outside the time it is executing.
The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.
Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.
The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.
There is no change to the property value between the time the animation is applied and the time the animation begins playing or after the animation completes.
style.properties.-o-animation-iteration-: Defines the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once.
Causes the animation to repeat forever.
style.properties.-o-animation-name.descr: Defines a list of animations that apply. Each name is used to select the keyframe at-rule that provides the property values for the animation.
style.properties.-o-animation-play-state: Defines whether the animation is running or paused.
A running animation will be paused.
Resume playback of a paused animation.
style.properties.-o-animation-timing-fun: Describes how the animation will progress over one cycle of its duration. See the 'transition-timing-function'.
style.properties.-o-animation.descriptio: Shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.
style.properties.-o-animation.values.alt: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.
The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.
style.properties.-o-animation.values.bac: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.
style.properties.-o-animation.values.bot: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.
style.properties.-o-animation.values.for: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.
style.properties.-o-animation.values.inf: Causes the animation to repeat forever.
style.properties.-o-animation.values.rev: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.
style.properties.-o-border-image.descrip: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.
If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.
Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.
The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.
The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.
The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.
The image is stretched to fill the area.
style.properties.-o-object-fit.descripti: Specifies how the contents of a replaced element should be scaled relative to the box established by its used height and width.
style.properties.-o-object-fit.values.co: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while fitting within the element's content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a contain constraint against the element's used width and height.

The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while filling the element's entire content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a cover constraint against the element's used width and height.
style.properties.-o-object-fit.values.fi: The replaced content is sized to fill the element's content box: the object's concrete object size is the element's used width and height.
style.properties.-o-object-fit.values.no: The replaced content is not resized to fit inside the element's content box
style.properties.-o-object-fit.values.sc: Size the content as if 'none' or 'contain' were specified, whichever would result in a smaller concrete object size.
style.properties.-o-object-position.desc: Determines the alignment of the replaced element inside its box.
style.properties.-o-tab-size.description: This property determines the width of the tab character (U+0009), in space characters (U+0020), when rendered.
style.properties.-o-table-baseline.descr: Determines which row of a inline-table should be used as baseline of inline-table.
style.properties.-o-text-overflow.descri: Text can overflow for example when it is prevented from wrapping
style.properties.-o-text-overflow.values: Clip inline content that overflows. Characters may be only partially rendered.
Render an ellipsis character (U+2026) to represent clipped inline content.
style.properties.-o-transform-origin.des: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.
style.properties.-o-transform.descriptio: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.
style.properties.-o-transform.values.mat: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]
Specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.
style.properties.-o-transform.values.rot: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.
Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.
Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.
Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.
Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.
style.properties.-o-transform.values.sca: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.
Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.
Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.
Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.
Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.
style.properties.-o-transform.values.ske: Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).
Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.
Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.
style.properties.-o-transform.values.tra: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.
Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.
Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.
Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.
Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.
style.properties.-o-transition-delay.des: Defines when the transition will start. It allows a transition to begin execution some period of time from when it is applied.
Specifies how long the transition from the old value to the new value should take.
Specifies the name of the CSS property to which the transition is applied.
Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.
style.properties.-o-transition-timing-fu: Describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated.
style.properties.-o-transition.descripti: Shorthand property combines four of the transition properties into a single property.
style.properties.-o-transition.values.al: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.
style.properties.-webkit-animation-delay: Defines when the animation will start.
style.properties.-webkit-animation-direc: Defines whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.
The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.
The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.
All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.
style.properties.-webkit-animation-durat: Defines the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.
style.properties.-webkit-animation-fill-: Defines what values are applied by the animation outside the time it is executing.
The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.
Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.
The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.
There is no change to the property value between the time the animation is applied and the time the animation begins playing or after the animation completes.
style.properties.-webkit-animation-itera: Defines the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once.
Causes the animation to repeat forever.
Defines a list of animations that apply. Each name is used to select the keyframe at-rule that provides the property values for the animation.
style.properties.-webkit-animation-play-: Defines whether the animation is running or paused.
A running animation will be paused.
Resume playback of a paused animation.
style.properties.-webkit-animation-timin: Describes how the animation will progress over one cycle of its duration. See the 'transition-timing-function'.
style.properties.-webkit-animation.descr: Shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.
style.properties.-webkit-animation.value: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.
The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.
The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.
Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.
The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.
Causes the animation to repeat forever.
All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.
style.properties.-webkit-appearance.desc: Changes the appearance of buttons and other controls to resemble native controls.
style.properties.-webkit-backdrop-filter: Applies a filter effect where the first filter in the list takes the element's background image as the input image.
Applies a Gaussian blur to the input image.
Applies a linear multiplier to input image, making it appear more or less bright.
Adjusts the contrast of the input.
Applies a drop shadow effect to the input image.
Converts the input image to grayscale.
Applies a hue rotation on the input image.
Inverts the samples in the input image.
Applies transparency to the samples in the input image.
Converts the input image to sepia.
A filter reference to a <filter> element.
style.properties.-webkit-backface-visibi: Determines whether or not the 'back' side of a transformed element is visible when facing the viewer. With an identity transform, the front side of an element faces the viewer.
style.properties.-webkit-background-orig: For elements rendered as a single box, specifies the background positioning area. For elements rendered as multiple boxes (e.g., inline boxes on several lines, boxes on several pages) specifies which boxes 'box-decoration-break' operates on to determine the background positioning area(s).
style.properties.-webkit-border-before-c: The -webkit-border-before-color CSS property sets the color of the individual logical block start border in a single place in the style sheet.
style.properties.-webkit-border-before-s: The -webkit-border-before-style CSS property sets the style of the individual logical block start border in a single place in the style sheet.
style.properties.-webkit-border-before-w: The -webkit-border-before-width CSS property sets the width of the individual logical block start border in a single place in the style sheet.
style.properties.-webkit-border-before.d: The -webkit-border-before CSS property is a shorthand property for setting the individual logical block start border property values in a single place in the style sheet.
style.properties.-webkit-border-image.de: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.
style.properties.-webkit-border-image.va: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.
Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.
The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.
The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.
The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.
The image is stretched to fill the area.
style.properties.-webkit-box-align.descr: Specifies the alignment of nested elements within an outer flexible box element.
style.properties.-webkit-box-align.value: If this box orientation is inline-axis or horizontal, all children are placed with their baselines aligned, and extra space placed before or after as necessary. For block flows, the baseline of the first non-empty line box located within the element is used. For tables, the baseline of the first cell is used.
Any extra space is divided evenly, with half placed above the child and the other half placed after the child.

For normal direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element. For reverse direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element.

For normal direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element. For reverse direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element.
The height of each child is adjusted to that of the containing block.
style.properties.-webkit-box-direction.d: In webkit applications, -webkit-box-direction specifies whether a box lays out its contents normally (from the top or left edge), or in reverse (from the bottom or right edge).
style.properties.-webkit-box-direction.v: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from left to right. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from top to bottom.
A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from right to left. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from bottom to top.
Flexible elements can be assigned to flex groups using the 'box-flex-group' property.
style.properties.-webkit-box-ordinal-gro: Indicates the ordinal group the element belongs to. Elements with a lower ordinal group are displayed before those with a higher ordinal group.
style.properties.-webkit-box-orient.desc: In webkit applications, -webkit-box-orient specifies whether a box lays out its contents horizontally or vertically.
style.properties.-webkit-box-orient.valu: Elements are oriented along the box's axis.
The box displays its children from left to right in a horizontal line.
The box displays its children from stacked from top to bottom vertically.
style.properties.-webkit-box-pack.descri: Specifies alignment of child elements within the current element in the direction of orientation.
style.properties.-webkit-box-pack.values: The extra space is divided evenly, with half placed before the first child and the other half placed after the last child.

For normal direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child. For reverse direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child.

The space is divided evenly in-between each child, with none of the extra space placed before the first child or after the last child. If there is only one child, treat the pack value as if it were start.

For normal direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child. For reverse direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child.
style.properties.-webkit-box-reflect.des: The -webkit-box-reflect CSS property lets you reflect the content of an element in one specific direction.
style.properties.-webkit-box-reflect.val: Are keywords indicating in which direction the reflection is to happen.
Are keywords indicating in which direction the reflection is to happen.
Are keywords indicating in which direction the reflection is to happen.
Are keywords indicating in which direction the reflection is to happen.
style.properties.-webkit-box-sizing.valu: The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) on this element determine the border box of the element.
Behavior of width and height as specified by CSS2.1. The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) apply to the width and height respectively of the content box of the element.
